snippet: South Africa’s police commissioner described a desperate struggle by the police to contain a machete-wielding crowd of angry miners in a strike at a platinum mine.
abstract: South African Police Commissioner Riah Phiyega defends the actions of police officers who fired on striking workers at a platinum mine in Marikana; shootout, which leaves 34 people dead and 78 wounded, marks country's worst labor-related violence since 1994.
lead_paragraph: South Africa’s police commissioner described a desperate struggle by the police to contain a machete-wielding crowd of angry miners in a strike at a platinum mine.

headline.seo: South African Police Official Defends Officers Who Fired on Miners
headline.main: South African Official Defends Police Killing of 34
headline.print_headline: South African Police Official Defends Officers Who Fired on Miners
